title: PSA: Each player can only have 3 stealth wards and 1 control ward out at once.
body:
You know what that means?

It means that the support, while they DO ward more than any other role, CAN'T keep vision of the entire map.

Even if we are at ward cap, the map is still going to be dark unless you provide some vision yourself.
So, stop bitching for one minute and buy a goddamn {{item:2055}}

replies.body: I think the biggest mistake is to stop warding when you're behind. If you're ahead and you're taking their jg, at least 1 person will ward deep. But if your team is behind and they're taking YOUR jungle, it's like insta every1 stops warding and I'm begging every1 to ward to no avail, so there's no come back if we keep being jumped from random bushes.

The only problem is that it is very dangerous for a support (who is likely to be anywhere from 2-4 levels behind on the losing team compared to the winning team's laners) to ward your own jungle because of how easy you are to kill. A random jungler could come out at any moment from any number of fog of war places and there isn't much a support can do about it. Now how 2 people going into the jungle to ward together? Fat chance. In my ELO, it is highly unlikely a behind solo laner would give up CS just to ward with the support. I speak from experience.

Warding in numbers is still pretty sparsely done in my elo, and it's more me thinking 'oh hey there goes our jg to do ???, maybe I'll follow him and drop some wards' rather than actual coordination.

When things are going rough and warding gets scary, it can turn into a routine of backing for wards, firing a skillshot into the nearest brush, warding it, backing for more wards, repeating on the next furthest out brush, and so on. It's a tedious process of warding probably not so useful places just so you can safely ward more useful places, but it at least can push out your ward line slowly but surely.

Is this uncommon knowledge or something, why is a PSA for such basic game knowledge necessary?

I guess from your high seat in Gold you don't know this, but Bronze is full of people who think a support can somehow ward the entire map. 

Sure we can keep a quadrant of the map warded if we're backing to refill sightstone, but beyond that we do need help. Honestly, if everyone's dropping their trinket wards on CD, we can keep half the map fully warded at all times.

Seeing as how you took the time to look up my account, you would also realize I have roughly 30 games played on this account(or somewhere around that). I'm not a gold player so you can keep that out of your conversation, there was no reason to even put that in the comment.

I would like to point out that the entire map doesn't have to be warded, only important areas in certain points of the game need to be controlled, so while the support can't do every bit of warding they can control enough for their team to heavily benefit from it.

My question still stands though, how is not common knowledge that everyone should be warding to the best of their abilities?

I didn't actually look at your account beyond rank to make sure you weren't also a bronzie.

All my comment was meant to communicate is that down here in Bronze, you can't take anything for granted. Teams do things for no reason whatsoever and players don't understand that placing a single control ward after their first back does not mean they're doing their part to ward the map.

I interpreted "high seat in gold" as sarcastic, seeing as how gold is pretty low in itself.

Honestly if in bronze, I'd be grateful if anyone buys any control wards at all. Atleast they're doing something, where as back in S4 I saw bronze games from someone I was coaching where not a single ward was placed. Not even a trinket, ever.

Just a note, Gold represents the top 20% of players in League, so... *shrug*

Anyway, yeah... down here, people are fucking idiotic. 

I had a lux support ask: 
"Why would I buy sightstone if it doesn't give me damage?" 

"I don't know, do you like having extra health?"

Just... logic doesn't exist down in Bronze, and I'm looking forward to the day I have the time to actually climb out.

I like to grab a control ward first back mid, second back top, first/second back support.
Jg are starting to by the green item which is nice for supports. Should be advertised more. It's the most useful and the least used.

It's not the best one, unless you're Lee.

Unless you CONSTANTLY use your control wards and trinkets, the map will be dark. And you shouldn't burn trinkets, because it's always good to keep one ward on you, especially lategame.

Riot gutted vision a few seasons back.

I buy Green smite on a lot of champs inless I absolutely feel like I need Chilling/Challenger smite.

I like to either protect my lanes or track the enemy jungler. Also like having Red trinket.

Vision is as useful as the players that use it. In bronze, you can have the whole map warded and mid laners will be surprised when the support roams mid, and when they die, they'll blame bot for not calling mia.
